subject: Gliding Challenge - Win Medals and Primogems!
content:
Hughes the adventurer is a Wind Glider enthusiast. He's traveling the world, and it seems he has discovered a few perfect gliding spots recently...


During the event period, Travelers can complete time-trial gliding challenges to win Talent Level-Up Materials, Primogems, Mora, and Hero's Wit!

 

〓Event Duration〓

2020-12-04 10:00:00 - 2020-12-14 03:59:59

 

〓Eligibility〓

Reach Adventure Rank 20 or above, and complete Hughes' quest Fly High.

 

〓Event Details〓

In the Gliding Challenge, Travelers can put their gliding skills to the test in a total of seven different gliding courses.

Over the seven-day event period, one gliding course will unlock each day. Look for the icon on the map, head to the starting point, and complete the

 challenge to win rewards.

● New gliding techniques are available for the Gliding Challenge: Sprint and Ascend, which are only available during the challenge itself.

● The more quickly you complete the course, the more insignia you will collect and the higher your score will be at the end of the challenge. Reach target scores to win medals and rewards.

● If you spend too long on a challenge or land for too long, you will fail the challenge and have to restart.

● The challenge score progress meter only records your personal best for that particular course.

● Before the event ends, you can attempt challenges as many times as you like to improve your top score.

● Complete new event-related missions under Fading Star to receive BEP.

(Above times are all displayed according to your server time.)

Note: Different servers do not have the same server times. Travelers, please take note of the difference between server times and the time in your own time zone as follows:

America: UTC-5

Europe: UTC+1

Asia: UTC+8

TW, HK, MO: UTC+8

For PlayStation® users, please read this FAQ for more information if you are unsure about the server your account is on.

subject: "Travels Afar" Scenic Spot Collaboration Documentary - Guilin Chapter | Genshin Impact
content:
It has been said that "Guilin has the best scenery in the world". In our eyes, this beauty lies not just in the sprawling mountains and winding rivers, but also in the fishing boats, the brick houses, smoking chimneys, and fishermen's songs. Guilin's landscapes and cultural elements played a huge role in inspiring the creation of one of Liyue's iconic areas, Dihua Marsh.


It is our greatest wish to create an open world that players will want to spend time exploring and immersing themselves in, and we will always keep striving towards that goal.

subject: "Gliding Challenge" Event Details
content:
​

Hughes the adventurer is a Wind Glider enthusiast. He's traveling the world, and it seems he has discovered a few perfect gliding spots recently...


〓Event Duration〓

2020/12/4 10:00:00 — 2020/12/14 03:59:59 (Server time)


〓Eligibility〓

Reach Adventure Rank 20 or above, and complete Hughes' quest "Fly High".


〓Event Rewards〓

During the event period, Travelers can complete time-trial Gliding Challenges to win Talent Level-Up Materials, Primogems, Mora, and Hero's Wit!


New event-related BP Missions have been added to Fading Star. Complete them to receive BEP.



〓Event Gameplay〓

During the event, a new gliding course will be unlocked each day.


The final score for a given course will be determined by the time spent to complete the course and the number of insignias collected along the way.


Rewards will be determined by the final score achieved at the end of the challenge.


​


Talk to Hughes the adventurer at the specified location and interact with the nearby mechanism to begin the "Gliding Challenge" event.


Each day, you can attempt the same course as many times as you like to set a new high score.


​


During Gliding Challenges, you can use the Ascend skill while in flight. Using this skill will cause you to fly a certain distance directly upwards.


​


During Gliding Challenges, you can collect particles in the air to charge up your Sprint ability. Once fully charged, use this ability to hurl yourself forward through the air.


​


You can store up to a maximum of two full Sprint charges.


​


If you spend too long on a challenge or land for too long, you will fail the challenge and have to restart.

During the challenge, pay attention to your altitude and remaining skill charges, collect enough particles, and utilize your skills at critical moments to speed through the course.


You will encounter various obstacles in "Gliding Challenge" courses to test your ability to navigate in the skies.


Wind Breakers are unusual Anemo rings that do not allow any wind to pass through them. Perhaps it'd be best to find a way around these strange rings.


​


Dusty Balloons are filled with dirty air. If you collide with one, the resulting dust cloud will hinder your view.

​


Just as their name implies, Explosive Balloons are hazardous items that can explode. If you happen to collide with one, the resulting explosion will send you hurtling through the air.


​


If you want a smooth flight through each course, perhaps it'd be best to find a way around all these obstacles.


That's all the latest details for this event! Stay tuned for future notices about new event gameplay and details!

subject: Developers Discussion - 12/04
content:
Q1: I wish there was a private chat function, so I could chat to friends before entering their worlds.

A1: A chat function is coming in Version 1.2. Travelers who have unlocked the friend system can chat with friends from the Friends screen or via a shortcut button.

If your friend is offline, they will receive your message the next time they log in.


Q2: My friends keep changing their nicknames all the time and I can't remember who is who. I wish I could add a note.

A2: In Version 1.2, Travelers will be able to select a friend's avatar and add a name for them in a note. The name you add will show up in your friends list and in chats, and only you will see the name you have given them. Hopefully that will make it easier to remember who's who!


Q3: I wish that I could add a trackable pin so that after closing the map I know which way to go, just like with quest objectives. It gets annoying having to repeatedly open the map and check on a journey because you keep going off track along the way.

A3: The developers are planning to release a trackable map pins feature. Travelers will just need to select a Custom Pin from the map screen and choose Navigate. Only one pin can be tracked at one time.


Q4: I wish I could repeat a Domain without having to leave and re-enter.

A4: In Version 1.2, Travelers will be able to choose to repeat a Domain challenge from inside the Domain. No more leaving and re-entering!


Q5: I frequently miss out on Domain and Ley Line blossom drops. Having to manually collect them is very inconvenient.

A5: The developers have improved the Domain and Ley Line Outcrop rewards system. From Version 1.2, you won't have to collect the drops yourself because they'll be added straight to your Inventory.


Q6: I want a dialog auto-play option.

A6: ...And the developers have almost finished making it! An auto-play option for dialog will be added in Version 1.2.

When the Auto option is selected, dialog will automatically progress to the next line once the current line's audio finishes playing. When dialog options appear, it will pause to allow Travelers to respond, then continue to auto-play as before.

*Also, there's now an option to skip the animation on the BP screen~


Q7: I wish there was a place to view the dialog for quests I have already completed. Sometimes it's nice to go back over the story.

A7: Version 1.2 adds the Travel Log section to the Archive. All dialog (text and audio) from previously completed Archon Quests and Story Quests will appear here. This way, Travelers can re-read and play back the dialog from completed quests.


Q8: In Co-Op Mode, progress is interrupted when a player quits the game. Can this be improved?

A8: The developers hear you loud and clear, Travelers! In the next version, Travelers are free to leave Co-Op Domains at any time without interrupting the battle for other Travelers. Also, during Co-Op sessions, the host will be able to disband the Co-Op Team just by returning to Single Player Mode. After the team is disbanded, Travelers' own game progress will be restored.


***Last But Not Least***

After the developers let us have one final peek at their notebooks, it turns out that in Version 1.2, Travelers will be rewarded with 1 Acquaint Fate each time they ascend a character at level 20, 50, or 70!

And for any previous characters that Travelers have ascended, you can claim the Acquaint Fate rewards from the Ascension Materials Preview screen.


The weather is getting colder these days. Look after yourselves, Travelers! (And stay away from snowy mountains! They're just not safe...)

Well, that marks the end of this Developer Discussion. Watch this space for more info on upcoming systems and characters! We certainly wouldn't want you missing out on any juicy details~

subject: "While It's Warm" - Complete Orders to Earn Primogems!
content:
Good Hunter, Wangshu Inn, and Wanmin Restaurant are currently facing a high volume of orders. They don't have enough delivery staff to cover them all and are looking for help.

During this event, fulfill timed food delivery orders from Sara at Good Hunter, Smiley Yanxiao at Wangshu Inn, and Chef Mao at Wanmin Restaurant to receive rewards — and complete all daily orders to get Primogems!


〓Event Duration〓

2020-12-11 10:00:00 – 2020-12-18 03:59:59


〓Eligibility〓

Reach Adventure Rank 20 or above


〓Event Details〓

During the event period, Travelers can take timed food delivery orders from Sara at Good Hunter, Smiley Yanxiao at Wangshu Inn, and Chef Mao at Wanmin Restaurant via the event menu.

Food must be delivered within the specified time limit and without breaking any other conditions that may apply depending on the food in question. These may include conditions against gliding, climbing, taking DMG, sprinting, and being affected by elements. Breaking these conditions will ruin the food, in which case Travelers will have to acquire a fresh portion and restart the delivery.

 

A reward is available for each fulfilled order.

Fulfill all 3 orders in a day to win Primogems.

New event-related BP Missions have been added to Fading Star. Complete them to receive BEP.

3 delivery orders will be available per day, refreshing at 04:00 daily.

If you can think of any other interesting things that you would like Paimon to report on, go ahead and write it in  the comments! Paimon will work harder to bring you the best reports of your adventures in Teyvat.

Submission Methods:

subject: While It's Warm - Event Details
content:
Teyvat is jam-packed with all kinds of delicious food! From Good Hunter's Fisherman's Toast and Wanmin Restaurant's Black-Back Perch Stew, to Wangshu Inn's Almond Tofu (¯﹃¯) ...Recently, these restaurants have been receiving some very specific orders, but there aren't enough delivery staff to cover them. This is where you come in, Travelers!​


Fulfill food delivery orders to win Mora, Character Ascension Materials, Adventurer's Experience, Mystic Enhancement Ore, and Primogems!

New missions have also been added to Fading Star. Complete them to receive BEP.


​


〓Event Duration〓

2020/12/11 10:00 – 2020/12/18 03:59


〓Eligibility〓

Reach Adventure Rank 20 or above


〓Gameplay Overview〓

During the event, take on orders from the While It's Warm page of the event menu, then follow the map to navigate to Sara at Good Hunter, Smiley Yanxiao at Wanmin Restaurant, or Chef Mao at Wanmin Restaurant accordingly.

(Once the event has been unlocked, Travelers may open the event menu by pressing F5 (PC), tapping the compass icon in the top-right corner (mobile), or holding the L1 button and selecting the compass from the Shortcut Wheel (PS4).)


​


​


Each order comes with a few special requirements, such as:

● Deliver within the time limit

● No sprinting

● No gliding

● No climbing

● Do not take DMG

● Do not become affected by any element

Make sure to read the requirements carefully before starting your deliveries! (~=∇=)~


​


After accepting an order, the countdown timer will begin. Travelers need to deliver the meal to the target location before the timer expires and without contravening any of the special requirements. Otherwise, the delivery will fail and you will need to go back to the restaurant NPC to restart.


​

Useful tip: Keep your eye on the weather and the climate during the delivery~


〓Event Rewards〓

● The event lasts 7 days with 3 new orders available each day. Each completed order brings a reward, and completing all 3 orders in a day brings a bonus reward.

● Orders refresh at 04:00 each day, and so do the rewards. Travelers should claim their rewards promptly after completing orders.


​


〓Notes〓

Each order can be completed only once. An order cannot be attempted twice, nor its reward claimed twice.

You can only accept one order at a time. Please complete the order you have currently accepted before taking another one. Travelers can check the current order under Story Quests in the Quest Menu~

Unfinished orders will not carry over to the next day, so please complete them in good time to avoid disappointment~

Okay, that's about it for this event! Mmm, the thought of all that delicious, hot food has got me drooling (¯﹃¯) ...Ahem. See you again soon!

subject: Version 1.2 "The Chalk Prince and the Dragon": New Gameplay & Features
content:
​

Greetings, Travelers! The December version update for Genshin Impact is just on the horizon. This latest update will feature an all-new area known as Dragonspine! But before you pack your bags and prepare for the perilous hike, we'd like to take a moment to introduce more about this snowy area.


〓New Area: Dragonspine〓

In Version 1.2, Travelers will be able to put their adventuring skills to the test in the all-new Dragonspine area. Here, Travelers will discover a whole new exploration experience, filled with various puzzles as well as new quests and mechanics awaiting at every turn.

​


▌Subzero Climate Details

A brand-new environmental mechanic has been specially added for the Dragonspine area — Subzero Climate. In the plummeting temperatures of Dragonspine, characters will continuously accumulate "Sheer Cold."

​


Once Sheer Cold reaches its limit, characters will start periodically losing HP.

​


Certain conditions like Snowstorms and actions like swimming will even accelerate Sheer Cold's accumulation.

​


​


Travelers will also discover that there are mechanisms which cast special effects on nearby monsters in Dragonspine. Before taking the monsters head on, be sure to try shattering those first!

​


Oh, and Travelers may recall the special compass we received previously to help locate treasure... Due to the effects of Dragonspine's unusual Ley Lines and extreme climate conditions, Travelers will be not be able to rely on such Gadgets in the Dragonspine area.


But fear not, brave Travelers! Next, we shall introduce some surefire ways to free oneself of Sheer Cold's icy clutches.

1. Use special environmental objects:

Travelers can turn to bonfires, Ruin Braziers, Teleport Waypoints, Statues of The Seven, and even Warming Seelie for relief from the Sheer Cold. Such objects emit warmth and will prevent further accumulation of Sheer Cold.

​


​


2. Eat special food:

Travelers may complete the Dragonspine quest "Ah, Fresh Meat!" to receive the recipe for Goulash. Eating this hearty dish slightly reduces the rate of Sheer Cold accumulation for all party members for duration of time.

​


3. Use special Gadgets:

Travelers may make offerings to the Frostbearing Tree to raise its level. Once the tree reaches a set level, you will obtain the blueprints for a Warming Bottle, a consumable item that grants resistance to Sheer Cold.

​



4. Collect Scarlet Quartz

Characters that are affected by Scarlet Quartz become completely immune to the effects of Sheer Cold. Scarlet Quartz can be found scattered across the Dragonspine area. Next, we'll take a moment to go into more detail regarding this precious ore!


▌Scarlet Quartz

Scarlet Quartz is a type of mysterious crystal that can be found in Dragonspine. These crystals contain a kind of warming energy that will envelop characters upon being shattered.

Collecting Scarlet Quartz will temporarily halt the accumulation of Sheer Cold and provide resistance to its freezing effects for a set duration.

​



There is also some "peculiar ice" found in Dragonspine that neither be shattered with weapons nor melted with Pyro. Travelers must employ the effects of Scarlet Quartz to break through this special ice.

​



〓New Feature: Frostbearing Tree〓

The Frostbearing Tree is an ancient tree that tends to this snowy mountain.

​

While exploring Dragonspine, Travelers will sometimes stumble upon crystalline Crimson Agate, which can be offered to the Frostbearing Tree. Doing so will level up the Frostbearing Tree, granting Travelers various rewards that include Acquaint Fate, Intertwined Fate, a wind glider, as well as Gadget blueprints.

​


▌Frostbearing Tree Rewards

​


1. Warming Bottle

Once the Frostbearing Tree has reached Lv. 4, Travelers will be awarded a blueprint for crafting the Warming Bottle.

​

Use Flaming Flower Stamens and Starsilver to craft a Warming Bottle.

The Warming Bottle will enter a 120s CD upon use.

The bottle will emit warmth and reduce the accumulation of Sheer Cold in a small radius for a short duration.

​


2. "Frostbearing: Ancient Tree" Namecard Style

Once the Frostbearing Tree has reached Lv. 9, Travelers will be awarded the "Frostbearing: Ancient Tree" namecard style.

​


3. Catalyst Weapon: Frostbearer

Once the Frostbearing Tree has reached Lv. 10, Travelers will be awarded blueprints for forging the 4-star Catalyst weapon — Frostbearer.

​


4. Wings of Concealing Snow

Once the Frostbearing Tree has reached Lv. 12, Travelers will be awarded the stylized wind glider — Wings of Concealing Snow.

​



In addition to the rewards listed above, once the Frostbearing Tree has reached Lv. 8, Travelers will also unlock Crimson Wish. Five new Crimson Wish quests will become available every Monday and Friday, which can be completed to receive Crimson Agate.

The amount of Crimson Agate that can be found in Dragonspine is limited, but Travelers may complete Crimson Wish quests to collect more agate to offer to the Frostbearing Tree.

Crimson Wish will no longer refresh once the Frostbearing Tree has been raised to its max level.

​



〓New Domain: Peak of Vindagnyr〓

Upon completing the quest "In the Mountains," Travelers will unlock an all-new Domain at Dragonspine's summit known as the Peak of Vindagnyr. Challenge this Domain to receive Blizzard Strayer and Heart of Depth set artifacts.

​

In this Domain, characters will continuously accumulate Sheer Cold, while platforms in the challenge will intermittently switch between the Subzero and Warm statuses. The areas affected by the Warm status will diminish Sheer Cold, and areas affected by the Subzero status will accelerate Sheer Cold's accumulation.


〓New Event: The Chalk Prince and the Dragon〓

​


Travelers may complete The Chalk Prince and the Dragon storyline to obtain the event-exclusive sword — Festering Desire.

Completing specified quests during the event period will unlock new effects for Festering Desire, and the character that equips the cursed sword will receive some special buffs while exploring the Dragonspine area.

​


After unlocking the Dragonspine area, Travelers do not need to consume Original Resin to participate in the event. Rewards will be available for exchange via the Event Shop.

​

We'll be back soon with more details regarding the new events and gameplay. Until next time, may the wind guide you!

Albedo

Kreideprinz

Chief Alchemist of the Knights of Favonius

Vision: Geo

Constellation: Princeps Cretaceus



Despite his great achievements in the field of alchemy, he does not speak of the nature of things too hastily.


Wandering among ordinary folk oblivious to various truths of this world, he treats them with nothing but sincerity and kindness.


Polite and graceful, he seems withdrawn on the surface, but never hesitates to lend a helping hand.

No matter if you go way back, or he has just befriended you, he can always find time to draw an exquisite portrait for a friend.


The Chief Alchemist of the Knights of Favonius, Albedo, is a truly remarkable young man. All admire his scholarly attainments — citizens of Mondstadt and members of the Knights of Favonius alike.


"Genius," "Kreideprinz," or "Captain of the Investigation Team"... Such titles and honors are of no consequence to him when there is so much more research to conduct.


The pursuit of fortune and connections cannot hold a candle to his heart's desire — acquiring the limitless, obscure knowledge left behind by previous generations of scholars.

content:
How do you do, Travelers? The new version "The Chalk Prince and the Dragon" isn't just full of new gameplay, but new equipment too! Let's have a look at how you get it~



New Weapons


Summit Shaper (5-Star Sword)

◇ A symbol of a legendary pact, this sharp blade once cut off the peak of a mountain.

​

*Images are taken from a development version and are not indicative of the final product.


▌How to Obtain

While the event wish "Epitome Invocation" is available, the event-exclusive 5-star weapon Summit Shaper (Sword) will get a huge drop-rate boost!

▌Weapon Details

Increases wielder's Shield Strength (when the wielder is on the field, any currently active shield absorbs an additional amount of DMG). On hit, gives an ATK boost (max 5 stacks). When under the protection of a shield, the ATK boost effect is increased.

​

*Images are taken from a development version and are not indicative of the final product.


Festering Desire (4-Star Sword)

◇ A creepy straight sword that almost seems to yearn for life. It drips with a shriveling venom that could even corrupt a mighty dragon.

​

*Images are taken from a development version and are not indicative of the final product.


▌How to Obtain

Complete the Story Quest "Princeps Cretaceus Chapter: Act I" and the Event Quest "Festering Desire" to receive the exclusive sword, Festering Desire!

▌Weapon Details

Equipping the Festering Desire increases the DMG and CRIT Rate of Elemental Skills.

​

*Images are taken from a development version and are not indicative of the final product.


The character who equips the Festering Desire during "The Chalk Prince and the Dragon" event will receive special buffs in the Dragonspine area.

1. The character who equips this weapon during the event gains bonus DMG dealt via Scarlet Quartzes. They also deal additional CRIT DMG to enemies in the Dragonspine area.

2. The character who equips this weapon during the event will accumulate Sheer Cold at a slower rate. They also gain bonus CRIT Rate against enemies in the Dragonspine area.

3. The person who equips this weapon during the event will deal more DMG to enemies in the Dragonspine area.


Aside from the Festering Desire, Travelers can also obtain the weapons Snow-Tombed Starsilver (Claymore), Dragonspine Spear (Polearm), and Frostbearer (Catalyst) from exploration and other activities within the Dragonspine area.

◇ An ancient greatsword that was stored between frescoes. Forged from Starsilver, it has the power to cleave through ice and snow.

When exploring in Dragonspine, fulfill certain criteria to obtain the weapon Snow-Tombed Starsilver and unlock its forging blueprint.

​

▌How to Obtain

​

*Images are taken from a development version and are not indicative of the final product.

subject: "Stellar Reunion" Event: Returnees Can Get Prototype Rancour (Sword)!
content:
​


After the Version 1.2 update, Travelers who meet the Returnee Eligibility conditions can activate the "Stellar Reunion" returnee event for the opportunity to get the 4-star weapon Prototype Rancour (Sword), Primogems, Fragile Resin, and other rewards.

 

 〓Event Duration〓

 For 7 days after the "Stellar Reunion" event is activated.

 

 〓Returnee Eligibility〓

 Must meet the following conditions:

 Adventure Rank 10 or above.

 At least 14 days since last game login.

 Over 45 days since last activating the "Stellar Reunion" event.

 

 〓Event Details〓

 The "Stellar Reunion" event comprises four parts:

 ● "Reunion Rewards": During the event, returning Travelers can claim Primogems, Fragile Resin, and other rewards. Rewards can only be claimed once.

 ● "Passage of Time" Login Rewards: During the event, log in daily to claim Primogems, Fragile Resin, Hero's Wit, Mystic Enhancement Ore, and other rewards.

 ● "Homeward Path" Quest Rewards: During the event, complete designated quests each day to claim rewards and accumulate points. When your accumulated points reach a designated value, you can claim the bonus reward Prototype Rancour (Sword). This bonus reward can only be claimed once! The quest list refreshes every day at 4:00 AM. Remember to claim your rewards in time!

 ● "Reunion Blessing" Double Drops: Returning Travelers receive three extra opportunities each day to gain double drops. These can be used to obtain double the rewards from Petrified Trees in Domains, Blossoms of Wealth, and Blossoms of Revelation using Original Resin. The amount of double drop opportunities refreshes every day at 4:00 AM. Remember to use the opportunities in time!

 ● After the event ends, event progress will be cleared and any unclaimed rewards will be lost. Remember to claim your rewards in time!

 

 ※ The refresh times above are based on the time of the server you play on.

 The time zone of each server is:

 America (UTC-5); Europe (UTC+1); Asia (UTC+8); TW, HK, MO (UTC+8).

subject: The Chalk Prince and the Dragon - Gameplay Details
content:
If not for Sucrose, no-one would have known that Albedo is hiding a great secret — one that involves a mysterious unknown sword and a mountain entombed in ice for millennia... Onwards and upwards, Travelers! In spite of the bitter cold...

​


"The Chalk Prince and the Dragon" has now begun! New BP Missions have been added to Mountaineer's Endurance. Complete them to get BEP.

During the event, complete specified quests to obtain the weapon "Festering Desire" and three types of Essence. Spend Essence in the Event Shop to purchase items including Festering Dragon Marrow (refinement material for Festering Desire), Talent Level-Up Materials, and the Crown of Insight.

​


Event Duration

All times below based on server time


Event Gameplay Period: After updating to Version 1.2 – 2021/01/05 03:59

Act I Start: After updating to Version 1.2

Act II Start: 2020/12/25 04:00

Act III Start: 2020/12/28 04:00

Act IV Start: 2020/12/31 04:00


Event Shop Period: After updating to Version 1.2 – 2021/01/12 03:59

After the Event Shop closes, any remaining Essence in your possession will disappear. Don't forget to spend it in time.


Eligibility

Reach Adventure Rank 20 or above, complete the archon quest Prologue: Act II "For a Tomorrow Without Tears," and complete Albedo's story quest "Princeps Cretaceus Chapter" to unlock the event "The Chalk Prince and the Dragon."


Event Guidelines

Completing challenges and claiming rewards will not consume original Resin.

After the event gameplay ends on 2021/01/05, remaining Essence in Travelers' Inventories will not disappear and can still be spent at the Event Shop. The Event Shop will close on 2021/01/12, at which point any remaining Essence will disappear. Spend it while it lasts!


Event Rewards

Complete specified quests and challenges to claim the weapon "Festering Desire" and three kinds of Essence, namely Glimmering Essence, Warm Essence, and Miraculous Essence.

​


Essence can be used to purchase various items from the Event Shop, including Festering Dragon Marrow (refinement material for Festering Desire), Weapon Ascension Materials, Hero's Wit, Mystic Enhancement Ore, Talent Level-Up Materials, and the Crown of Insight.

​


As well as purchasing items at the Event Shop, Travelers will also receive rewards for each challenge completed, including Primogems, Mora, Character Level-Up Materials, and Weapon Ascension Materials.


Event Description

This event is divided into four stages: Act I, Act II, Act III, and Act IV.

Travelers can obtain the sword "Festering Desire" by completing the specified quest and improve the weapon's abilities by completing challenges. See below for more details on what's in this event.

Festering Desire

During the event, complete the quest "Festering Desire" to receive the sword of the same name, which has some magical properties.

Festering Desire has three special abilities, which can be activated by completing all challenges in Act I, Act II, and Act III, respectively. Complete all challenges in the first three acts to activate all of Festering Desire's special abilities.

Festering Desire's three special abilities are only effective during the event period. The character equipped with Festering Desire will receive the special bonuses it offers.

​

During the event period, Festering Desire receives a 1.5× Enhancement EXP bonus when leveling up. Refine the weapon using Festering Dragon Marrow to reach up to Refinement Level 5.

Festering Dragon Marrow can be purchased at the Event Shop with Glimmering Essence, Warm Essence, and Miraculous Essence.

​



Gameplay Overview

Act I

After updating to Version 1.2, the event gameplay period begins. Complete the quest "Festering Desire" to unlock Act I challenges. Details of the Act I challenges can be found under Act I on the event page.

​

After unlocking Act I, monsters in the Dragonspine area will drop Rime-Worn Fragments and Rime-Worn Crystals when defeated.

​

Collect enough Rime-Worn Fragments and Rime-Worn Crystals to reach the challenge goals. Once the challenge is completed, monsters will no longer drop Rime-Worn Fragments or Rime-Worn Crystals when defeated, and these challenge-specific items will disappear from your Inventory.

Travelers who complete all challenges in Act I will activate one of Festering Desire's abilities.


Act II

After Act II begins on December 25, complete the quest "Archon's Rival" to unlock Act II challenges. Complete challenges to obtain Glimmering Essence.

On the map, Travelers will find Testing Grounds marked in the Dragonspine area. Navigate to the Testing Grounds and activate the mechanism to start the challenge.

​

When the challenge starts, the monsters that appear will receive a buff from the Dragon Force within the Ley Lines. Approach these monsters with caution. At the same time, Snowstorms will cause Sheer Cold to accumulate more rapidly, so be sure not to stray too far from a Ruin Brazier during the battle.

subject: Regarding a Further Adjustment to Zhongli
content:
Dear Travelers,

We sincerely apologize for keeping you all waiting.

Since we announced the plan for adjustments to Zhongli, testers have provided the developers with a great deal of detailed feedback based on their actual in-game experience. Meanwhile, we have also received many valuable suggestions from Travelers across various social media channels. Once again, we would like to thank everyone for all your invaluable contributions.


We have now collated all Travelers' feedback and observed that the focus is on the following issues:

• Zhongli is a comparatively weak support character, especially in Co-Op scenarios.

• In parties with Geo Resonance effects, the support that Zhongli provides is less pronounced than other available Geo characters, giving him relatively low strategic value, especially considering that he is a 5-star character.

• In Single Player Mode, Zhongli is not very compatible in parties with non-Geo Elemental Resonance effects.


Based on these points, we have made a further adjustment to Zhongli that increases his functionality as a support character while also improving his performance in Geo parties, non-Geo parties, and Co-Op scenarios. The adjustment will be implemented in an update to the Version 1.3 test server on December 29, 2020.


Further Adjustment to Zhongli's Elemental Skill "Dominus Lapidis" (Hold):

When a character is protected by the Jade Shield, opponents within a set radius have all Elemental RES and Physical RES decreased by 20%. Effect cannot be stacked.

Image 1 shows the post-adjustment result, while Image 2 shows the pre-adjustment result.

​

Additional Adjustment Demonstration: Jade Shield RES Decrease Area Display

(Test version, not indicative of final product)



​

Additional Adjustment Demonstration: Jade Shield RES Decrease DMG Comparison

(Test version, not indicative of final product)



​

Additional Adjustment Demonstration: Jade Shield RES Decrease DMG Comparison (Co-Op)

(Test version, not indicative of final product)




A more detailed explanation of this adjustment is provided below.

————————

Elemental Skill: Dominus Lapidis (Hold)

Original Effect:

Causes nearby Geo energy to explode, causing the following effects:

• Creates a shield of jade. The shield's DMG Absorption scales based on Zhongli's Max HP and has 250% Geo DMG Absorption.

• Deals AoE Geo DMG.

• If there are nearby targets with the Geo element, it will drain a large amount of the Geo element from a maximum of 2 such targets. This effect does not cause DMG.


Effect After Original Adjustment:

Causes nearby Geo energy to explode, causing the following effects:

• If the maximum number of Stone Steles has not yet been reached, it will create a Stone Stele.

• Creates a shield of jade. The shield's DMG Absorption scales based on Zhongli's Max HP, and has 150% Physical DMG and Elemental DMG Absorption.

• Deals AoE Geo DMG.

• If there are nearby targets with the Geo element, it will drain a large amount of the Geo element from a maximum of 2 such targets. This effect does not cause DMG.


Effect After Further Adjustment:

Causes nearby Geo energy to explode, causing the following effects:

• If the maximum number of Stone Steles has not yet been reached, it will create a Stone Stele.

• Creates a shield of jade. The shield's DMG Absorption scales based on Zhongli's Max HP, and has 150% Physical DMG and Elemental DMG Absorption.

• When a character is protected by the Jade Shield, opponents within a set radius have all Elemental RES and Physical RES decreased by 20%. Effect cannot be stacked.

• Deals AoE Geo DMG.

• If there are nearby targets with the Geo element, it will drain a large amount of the Geo element from a maximum of 2 such targets. This effect does not cause DMG.


During the Version 1.3 beta testing period, we will continue to monitor data on the test server to see how the adjustments are performing and will be carefully listening to Travelers' feedback. Before Version 1.3 officially releases, we will confirm the finalized adjustment plan with everyone once more.

For the original adjustment plan, please see: https://genshin.mihoyo.com/en/news/detail/7524
